components.description: A large red question mark (?) symbol emoji.
components.title: Black Question Mark Ornament

description: A large red question mark (?) symbol emoji.
title: Black Question Mark Ornament

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.definition: Question Mark was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Black Question Mark Ornament” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015. Copy http://emojipedia.org/black-question-mark-ornament/
emoji_net_data.name: question mark

bn:00100783a: Unusual; odd; out of the ordinary; bizarre.
Out of the ordinary; odd; curious; unusual.
Beyond or deviating from the usual or expected

bn:00082817v: To ask for information, a reply or response on a given subject.

bn:00087189v: Consider unlikely or have doubts about

bn:00083309v: Be confusing or perplexing to; cause to be unable to think clearly

bn:00028425n: Doubt, a status between belief and disbelief, involves uncertainty or distrust or lack of sureness of an alleged fact, an action, a motive, or a decision.
Doubt is uncertainty in the context of trust, action, decision or belief.
The state of being unsure of something
A status between belief and disbelief, involves uncertainty or distrust or lack of sureness of an alleged fact, an action, a motive, or a decision
Challenge about the truth or accuracy of a matter.

bn:00047208n: Action of asking for information, a reply or response on a given subject.
The act or process of posing a question or making a request.
A question is a linguistic expression used to make a request for information, or the request made using such an expression.
Interrogative is a term used in grammar to refer to features that form questions.
A sentence of inquiry that asks for a reply

bn:00047210n: Punctuation mark that replaces the full stop (period) at the end of an interrogative sentence
The punctuation mark “?”, used at the end of a sentence to indicate a question.
The ? character, used as a punctuation mark or wildcard character.
A punctuation mark (?) placed at the end of a sentence to indicate a question

bn:00065224n: The marks used to clarify meaning by indicating separation of words into sentences and clauses and phrases
Symbols that indicate the structure and organization of written language, as well as intonation and pauses
A written sign used to mark the structure of a written text; either in between sentences or within sentences.
A set of symbols and marks which are used to clarify meaning in text by separating strings of words into clauses, phrases and sentences.
Punctuation is "the use of spacing, conventional signs, and certain typographical devices as aids to the understanding and correct reading, both silently and aloud, of handwritten and printed texts."

bn:00021788n: Confusion is the state of being bewildered or unclear in one's mind about something.
A mental state characterized by a lack of clear and orderly thought and behavior
The act of confusing or the state of being confused.
The state or quality of being confused
The state of being confused; misunderstanding.
